items.question: How is revenue sharing conducted?
items.answer: We plan to return 5% of the store's monthly sales to NFT holders. The frequency and method will be decided in consultation with lawyers, prioritizing legal compliance. In the future, we aim for automatic distribution via smart contracts.

items.question: Are there legal risks?
items.answer: This project operates in compliance with relevant laws such as the Entertainment Business Act, Payment Services Act, and Financial Instruments and Exchange Act. We are building a legal scheme under the supervision of dedicated lawyers and administrative scriveners. However, please understand the risks as regulations regarding crypto assets and NFTs may change.

items.question: Can I resell the NFT?
items.answer: Yes, secondary trading (resale) is possible on major NFT marketplaces like OpenSea and Magic Eden. Upon secondary trading, 3% of the transaction amount will be returned to the project as royalty, used for operating funds and holder returns.

items.question: Will the physical store really open?
items.answer: Yes, we are already proceeding with property selection and cast recruitment for the grand opening of the 1st store in the Shinjuku area, Tokyo, in February 2026. We will reliably launch the business leveraging the CEO's extensive track record and network in the industry.

items.question: Is cryptocurrency required for purchase?
items.answer: Basically, purchase will be made with Ethereum (ETH) or Solana (SOL), but we are also considering introducing credit card payments. We plan to provide a detailed guide so that first-time users can also purchase.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.content:
1. "NFT" refers to non-fungible tokens issued on the blockchain.
2. "Holder" refers to a person who legitimately holds an NFT issued by the Project.
3. "Wallet" refers to software for managing crypto assets and NFTs.

nft_rights.title: Rights of NFT
nft_rights.content:
1. Holders have the right to use and display their NFTs for personal purposes.
2. Holding an NFT does not grant voting rights or equity interest in the Project's operation.
3. Intellectual property rights belong to the Project and are not transferred to the Holder.
